meanings.definition: Excessive fondness for acquiring and possessing books.
meanings.sent1: Her bibliomanias led her to fill every corner of her house with books.
meanings.sent2: His bibliomanias drove him to visit every bookstore in town.
meanings.sent3: The bibliomanias of the librarian were so intense that she even dreamt of books at night.
meanings.sent4: His bibliomanias were like a hungry monster, always craving more books to devour.
meanings.sent5: The bibliomanias of the book club president was so contagious that soon everyone in the group had caught the book-collecting bug.

meanings.definition: A passion for collecting and owning books.
meanings.sent1: The bibliomanias of the old man was evident in his vast collection of rare books.
meanings.sent2: Her bibliomanias were well-known among her friends, who often gifted her books.
meanings.sent3: The bibliomanias of the bookshop owner was so strong that he never sold any of his books.
meanings.sent4: His bibliomanias shone through when he lovingly arranged his books by color on the shelves.
meanings.sent5: The bibliomanias of the young reader was like a flame that burned brighter with each new book added to the collection.
